main event: Three civilian observers reported seeing an unidentified flying object over Stoughton, Wisconsin, on March 2, 1967.
interesting points: The object was initially mistaken for a bright star but was found to be larger and was hovering close to the ground., The object hovered for 5 minutes before moving in a westerly direction., One eyewitness was a Chevy garage operator and another a salesman from Milwaukee., The sighting was confirmed by multiple witnesses who described the object with varying sizes., Local police reportedly received other similar reports from additional witnesses.
sighted object: long/oval object emitting a light yellow to bright white glow
witness description: civilians including a Chevy garage operator, a salesman from Milwaukee, and a truck driver
